title: I think I know why I don't like reading anymore. How do I pick it up again? - Quora

response.answer_text: find a genre or concept that you know you like and then find books based on that, for example if your favorite genre is romance and you like those guy next door concepts then find a book that is like that. if you need recommendations there are always articles on google that give plenty of recommendations.

I had answered a similar question earlier and I am putting my words here again: Years back, I had some real ‘pain in the neck’ when I was building my reading habit. I had to do it anyway, so the only option I had was ‘commitment and the commitment to the commitment’. I gathered motivation and emotional support from my friends who were voracious readers. I started with short books, I started with merely 2/3 pages a day. I would read them and talk about the content with my near ones. That helped me a lot. I gradually increased the number of pages daily, and the volume of books also got upgraded. I picked the genre that appealed to me the most. Now, reading is a core habit and I have at least one book on my bed all the time. PS: There’s a simple fact about ‘habit’ - if you are doing it, you are getting results, if you are not doing it, you get absolutely zilch!
